p: Malaria is considered the most important parasitic disease of human beings and is currently endemic and transmitted by anopheline mosquitoes in more than 80 countries inhabited by approximately three billion people ( Table S1; Figure 1), especially in sub-Saharan Africa, where more than 85% of cases and 90% of deaths occur, mainly in children younger than 5 years old. Malaria continues to cause phenomenal damage to public health (228 million cases worldwide, with 213 million (93%) reported in Africa alone, and severe outbreaks have recently ravaged many areas [ 15, 16, 17, 18, 19].
